===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|ひこ|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ひこ}}. Originally {{IPAchar|/pi<sub>1</sub>ko<sub>1</sub>/}}. {{IPAchar|*[piko]}} → {{IPAchar|[ɸiko]}} → {{IPAchar|[hiko]}}. Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひこ|日|tr1=hi|t1=sun|子|tr2=ko|t2=child; boy}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The female equivalent is {{m|ja|姫|tr=hime}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひこ|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ひこ}}

# a male child; a boy
# an honorary male child; prince
# chieftain; in ancient Japan, the ruler of a regional land
